text: Working with Julie Andrews is like getting hit over the head with a valentine.
author: Christopher Plummer

text: I'd rather have roses on my table than diamonds on my neck.
author: Emma Goldman

text: How sweet it is!
author: Jackie Gleason

text: I'm a laugh tart. I make no secret of that fact.
author: Hugh Grant

text: In a recent Valentine's Day posting on her fan website, Britney Spears says that - oh, who cares?
author: Amy Poehler

text: A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.
author: Coco Chanel

text: I like perfume and flowers.
author: Donatella Versace

text: Look, there's no metaphysics on earth like chocolates.
author: Fernando Pessoa

text: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have lost at all.
author: Samuel Butler

text: Sometimes I'm so sweet even I can't stand it.
author: Julie Andrews

text: It's better to have loved and lost than to have to do forty pounds of laundry a week.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Husbands are like fires - they go out when they're left unattended.
author: Cher

text: Everything's coming up roses - for me.
author: Ethel Merman

text: I'm like the kid in kindergarten I really do send valentines to everyone.
author: Susie Bright

text: I'd kiss a frog even if there was no promise of a Prince Charming popping out of it. I love frogs.
author: Cameron Diaz

text: We are each of us angels with only one wing, and we can only fly by embracing one another.
author: Luciano De Crescenzo

text: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.
author: John Keats

text: Love is when the desire to be desired takes you so badly that you feel you could die of it.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

text: I want a man who's kind and understanding. Is that too much to ask of a millionaire?
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

text: Soul meets soul on lovers' lips.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.
author: Blaise Pascal
